[Teacher]: . This is an example of the following literary devices: A) Hyperbole B) Alliteration C) Personification D) Allusion E) Metaphor The correct answer is E) Metaphor. A metaphor is a comparison between two unlike things without using "like" or "as." In the passage, the phrase "he used to see him dancing in the park when he was young" is a metaphor because it compares two different things (a person and a dance) without using "like" or "as." Similarly, the phrase "he became so popular that they could not understand his words anymore" is a metaphor because it compares the spread of popularity to a physical phenomenon (the inability to understand words). [Student]: I should think they would be happy to take me away if there was anything worth having And Betty looked up brightly as she spokeOh dear
[Teacher]: no, I dont have any pets of my own But I do have a friend who has an old dog, a big greyhound, and I do love going to visit him. He's very good with children, and I like watching him run and play in the yard. I think they must be happy to take their owners away on all those adventures, but I suppose they have to have their reasons for it! (smiling) And I think its rather lovely that you have a house full of children who are all the same age. STARTER: Do you enjoy cooking at home? What's the best meal you've made recently, or do you prefer eating out?
text:
[Starter]: Do you enjoy cooking at home? What's the best meal you've made recently, or do you prefer eating out?
[Student]: What is it that keeps the girls in the lonesome for more than a week For Nathalie was speechless with her usual frenzy as she answered Tom and Phil promptly upon their questions about it on this occasion and of course there was no time to tell from the others what she thought they were going to make up their minds by talking about it when they got back to school and decided to take only a few days off to school
[Teacher]: . The following day we all got up early and set out for school. This day was the first time they had made up their minds and finally decided on what they decided to do.  The first thing they decided was to have a meeting with their headmaster and to tell him everything.  The headmaster was called and came to the meeting,  Tom and Phil were both very nervous and fidgety.  As soon as the headmaster sat down,  they started talking about what happened that day.  We were all listening with our ears wide open.  The headmaster listened with a careful and serious face.  Finally, after they had finished talking, he looked at us and said,  "I must say,  what
[Student]: did you decide and then said quicklyWell I didnt know whether Id planned thatit would be better if I could go back to bed just once before school begins Then he put his lips together and said slowlyOh dear
[Teacher]: , I did something that is against the school rules and it is against the rules to take someone to the market on a week day but I didnt know it because we only had the bus to take to the market so I had to get off the bus and walk the rest of the way to get to the market.  We were all shocked by his words and it took a few moments for him to continue,  but he did.  He said it was a day much like any other school day at the beginning of the week, we got up early and got dressed as usual.  We went down to the kitchen to have a breakfast together and then we went on our way to the bus stop.  I remember getting off the bus and walking

STARTER: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
text:
[Starter]: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?

[Teacher]: The person you're asking is likely a language model, which means they don't have personal preferences or experiences, but I can tell you about different genres of music and recommend some popular artists and songs if you're interested! STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Do you have a real wedding of yours at home The man smiled in a gentle way as he spoke to her and said nothing unkindly but that she was glad he had come along so well when his mother said it would be best for him to go back to the ranch and live close by with her brothers children until Thanksgiving if we could find them again without us knowing anything about them all except those who were really kind friends with meso I told her about what fun these poor people might have on their return trip down south and where they should have a chance to visit one another in some time during the summer vacationthat is the reason why I am not doing this thing right now
[Teacher]: so that you and your family might be able to find these people and help them out and I told you that it was a great idea because that would be a good excuse to go down there and have a visit with them and my daughter and I have been to them once already before and we know that they would certainly welcome a visit from you and your family as well as the rest of us who are truly happy to have you as part of our family. They had a nice Thanksgiving dinner on the home ranch but after dinner the man and his family made plans to visit their friend in town and she had to stay home and take care of the younger children in the kitchen and her husband had to take care of the older children in the kitchen and his wife
[Student]: did everything herself in order to make sure they could see you properly when possible and do not forget a new friendship with them at the house where you are always ready to spend an afternoon in other ways while going around the farm like other times on Thanksgiving eve I want to hear about Thanksgiving Day continues Joans reply My father has gone off and left me but he seems very unhappy and just how much I dread that Christmas day will last forever And Joans face clouded over this reply and she exclaimed delightedlyOh
[Teacher]: my goodness that is the best news I have heard today My brother and I are going to the city on Christmas day and we are going to see that wonderful man who is so kind and handsome and so full of kindness and who is a part of our family so that we can be together on this special day when the rest of our family will have left and when we are all going to have so much fun I do not want to be alone on Christmas day which is a very difficult time for me and I think I would be so grateful if you could come with us for Christmas day and we could all be together like a big happy family and I am so grateful that you are my brother and I am so happy that you are going to be a part
